conclusion: The objects meet when the distances they have traveled are equal.
The area under a velocity-time graph represents the distance traveled by the object.
Object A's velocity changes over time as shown by the curve.
Object B's velocity changes over time as shown by the different segments of the curve.
The distance traveled by each object can be found by calculating the area under their respective velocity curves.
Compare the distances traveled by A and B at different time intervals until they are equal.
From time 0 to t1, both objects have traveled the same distance and thus meet.
From time t1 to t2, both objects have again traveled the same distance and meet.
From time t2 to t3, both objects have traveled different distances and do not meet.
From time t3 to t4, both objects have traveled different distances and do not meet.
The two objects meet at times t1 and t2.
